DOC.brief_summary: Decreased body fat mass, possibly mediated through the effects of elevated serum adiponectin levels, may be associated with requirements for higher recombinant human erythropoietin doses and a subsequent worse prognosis in patients beginning hemodialysis.
DOC.brief_title: Recombinant Human Erythropoietin Dose, Serum Adiponectin, and All-Cause Mortality in Patients Beginning Hemodialysis
DOC.criteria: Patients who started hemodialysis therapy from August 2000 to May 2001 in 11 dialysis centers in the Shizuoka prefecture area, and who survived for more than 3 months after the start of hemodialysis. Nothing particular.
DOC.keyword: The relationship between all-cause mortality in patients introduced hemodialysis and recombinant human erythropoietin dose and serum adiponectin level
